intro: Trifidacanthus unifoliolatus, commonly known as the single-leaf trifidacanthus, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant exhibits a single, broad leaf that is deeply trifid, meaning it is divided into three parts, giving it a striking appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in inflorescences that add to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
